title: Manzanita Cycles Whippet Batch Pre-Order is Open
content:
Manzanita Cycles is now accepting reservations for a limited batch of six Whippet adventure gravel bikes, set for delivery in June and July. Designed and built by Manzanita Cycles owner Nick Jensen, the Whippet is a fast and comfortable steel gravel bike that blends modern performance with classic craftsmanship…

Manzanita’s Whippet adventure gravel bike features a double-butted, heat-treated chromoly steel frame paired with a Seido MGV carbon fork. With clearance for 2.25” tires, flat-mount brakes, and multiple mounting points for bottles and cargo, the Whippet is ready for everything from all-day adventure rides to gravel racing.

Whippet Quick Hits

  • $2,600 for the frameset
  • Made by Nick Jensen in Reno, NV
  • High-quality, lightweight steel tubing from Velospec and Columbus
  • Seido MGV carbon fork with 12x100mm axle, internal dynamo routing, and cargo mounts
  • 12x142mm rear spacing
  • Flat mount 140mm/160mm rear brake
  • Clearance for 29×2.25″ tires (sizes M4-M8)
  • Clearance for 650bx2.25″ tires (sizes M1-M3)
  • 27.2mm seatpost with internal dropper routing
  • Integrated rear rack mounts
  • Three bottle cage mounts
  • 68mm BSA bottom bracket shell
  • Wolf Tooth EC34/44 headset (sizes M3-M8) / EC44/44 (sizes M1-M2)
  • External cable routing (no zip-ties)
  • Compatible with 1x drivetrains up to a 42t

The Whippet comes in eight sizes to accommodate a wide range of riders. With only six frames available in this batch, now is the time to secure one before they’re gone.

For more details, including a link to place a deposit, visit Manzanita Cycles.
